A description of your facility and the regulated substances handled:

Ashland's Garland, TX facility is a chemical distribution warehouse.  The regulated substnace arrive at the warehouse loading dock, are transferred to storge and subsequently loaded for shipment without ever opening the containers.  The regulated substance is 30% solution of ammonia with water.

The worst case scenario:

The USEPA RMP regulations require the worst case release scenario to assume that the entire contents of the vessel of a regulated substance in a process are released.  Based on our analysis using USEPA approved methods, the worst case scenario could potentially effect offsite receptors, however there are no public offiste recpetors in the area impacted by the release.  There were no specific administrative controls considered in the analysis to limit the distance re

ported.  The passive mitgation considered in the analysis was the storage of the 30% ammonia solution in an enclosed building.

The alternate case scenario:

The USEPA RMP regulations require an analysis of the alternative case scenarios.  The alternative case release scenario represents an accidental release that is more reasonalbe than the worst case, but is still highly unlikely to occur.  Based on our analysis using USEPA approved methods, the alternative case release scenario for 30% ammonia solution could potentially effect offiste receptors, however there are no public off site receptors in the area impacted by the release.  There were no specific administrative controls or active mitigation measures considered in the analysis to limit the distance reported.  The passive mitigation considered in the analysis was the storage of 30% ammonia solution in an enclosed building.
